detaileddescription.para: The binary output format, psp is a generalized hierarchical self-describing format designed to keep most of the information about all components in a phase space that the code can be restarted from the dump file.
The following three utilities manipulate the phase-space files:

pspinfo OUT
Lists all of the dumps in a psp file (here name OUT) and their attributes.

pspstat OUT
Prints summary statistics (number of bodies, center of mass, center of velocity angular momentum, KE, PE, mass, etc.) for the PSP dump

psp2tipsy [-t TIME] OUT
Converts dump in file OUT at TIME to a tipsy format. Data is written to stdout. The tipsy components (dark, star, gas) are determined from the first word in the name field of each component.

pspsplit [-t TIME] OUT
Split out the dump at TIME from OUT. Data is written to stdout. Useful for restarting from a particular time point.

psp2ascii [-t TIME] OUT
Converts dump in file OUT at TIME to ascii files, one for each component. The format is the same for ascii initial conditions.

psp2ta [-t TIME] OUT
Write an array of a particular PSP double or integer attribute in particle order, primarily for use with Tipsy.

psp2histo [-t TIME] OUT
Make a histogram of position, velocity, or a articular PSP array attribute.

psp2histoE [-t TIME] OUT
Make a histogram of electron distribution properties (for use with DSMC)
